Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF SAFETY 1150 Foster Avenue Nashville, Tennessee 37249-1000 PHIL BREDESEN Governor DAVE MITCHELL Commissioner AGREEMENT BETWEEN TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF SAFETY AND COMMERCIAL DRIVER LICENSE THIRD PARTY TESTER ORGANIZATION THIS AGREEMENT is made effective this 25th day of May, 2007 and will expire the 24th day of May, 2008 by and between the Tennessee Department of Safety and Tennessee Board of Regents/Tennessee Technology Centers, hereinafter referred to as “Third Party Organization” or “Third Party Tester”, located at: Statewide. This agreement authorizes the named Third Party Organization to administer Commercial Driver License skills tests to qualified students, on behalf of the Tennessee Department of Safety. NOW THEREFORE, the Tennessee Department of Safety and the Commercial Driver License Third Party Tester Organization named herein in consideration of their mutual duties and responsibilities to one another hereinafter set forth, agree to the following: I. THE THIRD PARTY TESTER AGREES TO: A. Statutory Conform with all applicable statutes and regulations of the State of Tennessee, and of the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration. B. Requirements Document Abide by and conform to all applicable requirements of the Tennessee Department of Safety and Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration. C. Random Examination/lnspections/Audits Allow the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration or its representative and the Tennessee Department of Safety to conduct random examinations, inspections and audits of assessment instruments without prior notice. D. On-Site Inspections Permit the State or Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration to conduct on-site inspections at least annually. E. Sample Tests/Third Party Examiner Requirements Allow at least on an annual basis, Tennessee Department of Safety employees to take the tests actually administered by the third party tester as if the Tennessee Department of Safety employees were a test applicant, or allow the Tennessee Department of Safety to test a sample of drivers who were examined by the third party tester to compare pass/fail results. F. Third Party Organization Requirements . Abide by and conform to all applicable requirements, rules, policies and procedures promulgated by the Tennessee Department of Safety. G. The Party Organization, Otherwise Known As The Tennessee Board of Regents: Shall maintain bodily injury and property damage liability insurance on the motor vehicles in use pursuant to this agreement, specifically used in the student driving testing program administered by the Third Party Organization, insuring acts of negligence created by the testing program, the examiner, or any student officially enrolled in the driving testing program. The limits of liability shall equal the greater of combined single limits of $1,000,000.00 or minimum limits as required by state law. H. Certificate and Identification Cards Prominently display the third party tester certificate and copies of the examiner identification card(s), provided by the Tennessee Department of Safety, in their place of business. I. Proof of Testing Provide the driver applicant who takes and passes the skills tests, documented proof so they can provide evidence to the Tennessee Department of Safety licensing agency that they have successfully passed the driving tests administered by the third party tester. J. Additional Provisions Abide by and conform to all requirements of the Tennessee Department of Safety and Federal Highway Administration concerning Professional Conduct, Advertising, Insurance Requirements, Notification Requirements, and Test Administration. II. THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF SAFETY AGREES TO: A. Testing Permit the above named Third Party Tester to administer commercial driver license skill tests as specified in this agreement and the Commercial Driver Third Party Testing Requirements Documents, as part of this agreement. B. Administration and Enforcement Administer and enforce the provisions of the Commercial Third Party Testing Requirements Document as part of this agreement. III. TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT This agreement reserves unto the Tennessee Department of Safety the right to take prompt and appropriate remedial action against the named Third Party Organization in the event the Third Party Tester fails to comply with the terms of this agreement or with those requirements stated in the Commercial Third Party Testing Requirements Document as part of this agreement. IV. COMMUNICATIONS Notices and communication in writing required or desired to be given pursuant to this agreement shall be mailed to the following address: Tennessee Department of Safety Tennessee Department of Safety Attn: Driver License Issuance 1150 Foster Avenue Nashville, TN 37243 V. ENTIRE AGREEMENT Third Party Orqanization/Tester Tennessee Board of Regents Attn: Lana Pierce 1415 Murfreesboro Road/Suite 350 Nashville, TN 37217 This document, and the Commercial Third Party Testing Requirements Document, hereto constitutes the sole and entire agreement between the Tennessee Department of Safety and the Third Party Tester relating to the authority to administer the Commercial Driver License Skill Tests. No other terms or conditions shall form a part, hereof, and this agreement shall not be modified except by subsequent agreement in writing and attached as an addendum, duly signed by the authorized representatives of both parties. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this agreement as of the date first written above. THIRD PARTY ORGANIZATION: TENNESSEE BOARD OF REGENTS , TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF SAFETY TITLE: SIGNATURE: X PRINT NAME: Charles W. Chancellor TITLE: PRINT NAME: SIGNATURE^
